title: Is 'The Great Gatsby' a good book? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is a GREAT book. Offers social commentary relevant to today: alcohol, parties, sex, money, celebrity obsessed culture… sound familiar? It covers a fascinating time in history.Jam packed: Fitzgerald crams a well developed plot line and interesting characters combined with such a rich poetic writing style in a mere 47,094 words! That’s nothing considering the first Harry Potter book contains 76,944. This gives the book a great pace and will keep you engaged until the last page is turn. Of course it also makes it a fast read and easy to re-read.Great characters: From the ‘hulking’ Tom Buchanan to the delicate Daisy, and of course the mysterious Gatsby, the book contains truly iconic characters.Plot twists: Clever and unpredictable changes in the plot although the book is highly enjoyable even without these.It’s a classic: It has achieved such a timeless status that whether the book is ‘good’ or not it is still important to read due to it’s huge impact and large readership.Potential drawbacks: ‘Too short.’Language is very dense.Characters are not likeable.May need to be read multiple times to grasp.Hope this helped. Cheers old sport!  Matthew
